name: Flashiness / Rate & Frequency of Change
functionStatement: Integrates the range of "typical" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals).
descriptionMarkdown: Flashiness (rate and frequency of short-term flow fluctuations). Higher flashiness often reflects watershed alteration and can stress aquatic habitat and geomorphic stability.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel

Method: Desktop (gage/records) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute a flashiness metric (e.g., Richardsï¿½Baker Flashiness Index) from daily (or finer) discharge data, or apply a watershed proxy (e.g., curve number) where specified. Compare to reference conditions/quartiles and assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Flashiness / Rate & Frequency of Change
inputs.type: desktop (gage/records) with field verification where feasible
inputs.helpMarkdown: USGS NWIS streamflow records (where available); watershed land cover/soils for proxies.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: RBI ? 25% quartile value and ?75% quartile value. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: RBI declining over time and approaching 25% quartile value, or increasing and approaching the 75% quartile value. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: RBI <25% quartile value or >75% quartile value. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
